Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: marie o
Reviews.Content: I decided to visit my family in P.R after more than 10yrs. Then, we decided to visit Flamenco Beach and it was really paradise. The villa was AMAZING! It was equipped, clean, fresh,n o bad smells, decorated according to the environment. We stayed at 1D and we had it all. The outdoor shower was located right outside our villa. The people working there were so nice and genuine. My only advise is to buy enough food for your stay since the villas are a little far from town. I am planning to return next year. The beach was like a pool.... the sand, the breeze.... PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Come for the Beach”
Reviews.Author: curiousGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2A for three nights in mid march but did not quite have the same experience as the review from AMF2224. Yes the furnishings are old and warn and in desperate need of replacement. But we did not have any problems with bed bugs, the unit was clean and did not smell. Maybe the complaints helped. If you need 4 star accommodations, or even 2 star then these accommodations aren't for you. If you merely want a safe, fairly clean place to lay your head at night and wake up wake to one of the most beautiful beaches in the world then this is it. If you decide to stay here and want the ocean front units request 2B as the owner of this unit has furnished it nicely. It is too bad the there is not some sort of minimum requirements for the owners as the owner of 2A is probably the worst out of all of the units that we had the opportunity to see. Make sure you bring your own beach towels, shampoo, soap and every other personal hygiene products as not much is provided. In unit 2A the only hot water available is in the shower. The small cook area is equipped enough to prepare simple breakfasts and lunches.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Island Beaches and Water So Great”
Reviews.Author: jamiedavila
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Culebra Beach Villas. We were in #5. Traveled with my husband and 4 kids age 11, 4, and twins 18 months. We knew going in that the villas did not have cribs to rent or offer so we had to bring pack n plays. The Best thing about the beach villas are that they are right on flamenco beach. It is the most beautiful water/beach our family has ever been to. The villas were just ok. We read the reviews before coming so we were not expecting anything fancy. Our check in was fast as they charge you in full for your trip 2 weeks prior to you arriving so all we had to do was show up, it was already charged to us. We had a 1 bedroom for all of us. The beds were not very comfortable but we made do. My family loved the two hammocks and swing we had at our villa. We also had a large picnic table on the covered porch where we ate most meals. We read about mosquitos, yes there were some but we seemed to do ok. We also read about bed bugs, and did not seem to notice anything till we came home and had little bumps on our legs/arms but that could have been mosquito bites. BRING YOUR OWN BEACH TOWELS AS THEY DO NOT PROVIDE ANY. Also, they do not provide any soap, shampoo, or other. There is not maid service, or clean up service. On day two we did not get any fresh bath towels so I took it upon myself to take our used towels over to the crew and they gave me some fresh ones. The staff don't really bother you at all, so if you need something you can go looking for them. Wi fi worked during the day hours only, It seemed like every evening them must have turned it off or something. Cell phone signals are touch and go. Be warned, you will pay per person for a taxi so renting a car is a good idea. The grocery stores charge a lot for foods. We got basics and spent $90 for bread, p b and J, some waters, juices, snack items, and could not believe how the bills went up. We went to Milca grocery 3 times and spent $90 twice and $50 once for our 6 people. Kiosks close early, to our disappointment as we had 4 hungry kids and found them to close at 5pm one day and restaurants in town did not serve till after 6 pm. We were surprised at the lack on interest in "paying customers" as we arrived at Dinghy Docks one night for dinner. All that was open was the bar, we walked around looking for someone to seat us, greet us, or even give us the time of day and no one did. They had a sign that said dinner at 6pm it was 10 till and the waitress paid more attention to rolling silverware while talking on the phone and did not even bother to acknowledge us at all. We ended up going back to the villas and ate whatever we could find there. great snorkeling at Tamarindo Beach. We got to swim with the sea turtles and that was fun. We went twice. We would go back ONLY if we got a rental car in San Juan, stocked it up with the foods and supplies we needed first prior to coming to the island..... It was great water, great sun, great beach and the rest was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Already disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: I haven't even been there yet and I am already displeased with their response time. I emailed to get rates for particular dates--a gentleman (and I say that loosely) responded by telling me to call the office (which, if I wanted to do would have done that in the first place) between 10 and 3, but when I called, all I got was a message telling me the hours. I called several times. Then I e-mailed this person back to explain this--I have yet to hear back from anyone. I will pay extra to stay at Club Seaborne. No problem.

Reviews.Title: “not for the uppity”
Reviews.Author: lidia247
Reviews.Content: I love staying here...5 times now...six soon...if you want the hilton, stay on the mainland. Rugged...the beauty of the beach and the sound of the waves...the stars at night..the camp ground with all the great island foods. . i dream of being there...ahhhh. some rooms are great, others not so much. realize that the rooms/apartments are individually owned. i noticed a post on bed bugs......probably no-see-ums... they eat me up every time i go. they come out between 5-7 every evening for a feast. you cant see them and you dont know they have eaten you alive until the next day:( have your spray!! why do you think all those puerto ricans wear long pants and long sleeve shirts in that heat!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for nature and peace lover”
Reviews.Author: NatashaD_Montreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Culebra Island for 6 days. Those were the most beautiful days of last 15 years. The property is very clean and nice. We had 1C studio for 2 days and then, 2D apartment for maximum 4 people. For 2 people 1C was good enough. There was no window in the bedroom, which we found strange. However, because of that the room was absolutely calm and we slept very well even the studio was on the ground level and people walked near by. After 2 days we were scheduled to move to the next door apartment which we found to be very small. We found that 2D apartments was available and moved there (it is more expensive but really you should pay for it). It was perfect! We had side ocean view, nice breeze on the balcony, good size dinning room, leaving room and kitchen. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Beach is a dream! Water is calm warm and crystal clear. We will be back there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMF2224
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation at Culebra Beach Villas. While the Flamenco Beach is spectacular and second to none, I wish I could say the same about the accommodations at Culebra Beach Villas. We intially rented apartment 2A, a 2-bedroom oceanfront property; to say it was filthy is an understatement. There wasn't a single surface in the apartment that was clean, the stench was unbearable, the furnishings are old and worn, and, get ready for the best part...the place is infested with BED BUGS!! My husband and I were covered with bites; our vacation was ruined and we are still itching from the BED BUG bites nearly two weeks later. This is the part that amazes me...when they finally did move us to a tiny villa at the back of the property, I stopped at the office to advise them of the issue with the BED BUGS and staff in the office indicated that they were aware that the apartment was infested with BED BUGS and said that they had "tried" to spray for the BED BUGS, obviously ineffectively. She also indicated that they had talked to the owner of the unit a number of times in a effort to get him to clean the place up!! I was outraged to think that they charged us $250 a night for a place that was smelly, old, nasty, and they KNEW was infested with BED BUGS. We have traveled to a number of places throughout the Caribbean and by no means have we ever stayed in a 5 star resort or anything even remotely close. In fact, many of the places we have stayed in the past wouldn't even rate 1 star, but they are clean, clean, clean, which is all that really matters. It should be noted that each unit is independently owned, so the quality of the furnishings and interiors of the apartments and villas varies greatly since each owner is apparently responsible for the maintenance of their units. Our group rented a total of 5 apartment/villas and the quality ranged from horrible to adequate. Even though they did finally move us after the second night and refunded our money, I would not recommend Culebra Bach Villas to anyone unless you are well aware of the condition of the unit you are renting.

Reviews.Title: “Fell asleep listening the waves...woke up with the roosters!”
Reviews.Author: Tbouy
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from Culebra and had a great experience at Culebra Beach Villas. We were in villa #6 and it met all of our needs. The one bedroom unit was rather "Spartan" but was quite clean and fairly well equipped. How can you go wrong being only steps away from one of if not the most beautiful beach in the world? Lots of families in addition to couples. Lying in a hammock, reading a good book while enjoying a cooling breeze was a great way to spend a couple of hours each day. Don't forget to walk onto the beach at night to see the spectacular star show. I would return and am happy to answer any questions about my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the villas. They have the best location in Culebra ON the nicest beach in Culebra. Very friendly at the front desk although there is not much assistance after check in unless you need help between 9 and 5 Monday thru Friday. Full kitchen and basic necessities. Bring your own beach towels, soap and shampoo. It is definitely not The Ritz but it is sufficient for beach lovers. We will continue our tradition of a weekend a year at this locale. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Just not the place to go”
Reviews.Author: Olivia_Didier
Reviews.Content: I do not how to describe, it was just horrible. First time, last time. Price expensive for Bungalow and dirty as you can not imagine! Toilets broken...we arrived a the beginning of the evening, no lobby just key at the door. We did not sleep and we directly left the day after with the first boat. Maybe the beach is nice but do not stay in this bungalow !

Reviews.Title: “Definitley will come back”
Reviews.Author: Kt3re
Reviews.Content: Describe the service you experienced The service was great, we even checked in earlier than expected, the room was really clean and the staff was amazing, they provided towels and linens. there's also parking for RV/Boat/Trailer. It has a full kitchen (cooking utensils provided, refrigerator, microwave). It's a bit far from the main town (30-40 minute walk) but by renting a taxi, jeep or a golf car, but once you get there you don't wanna go out, because the. The best beach it 2 minutes walking distance. But all of this and more you have to experience by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Experience The Best Of Culebra”
Reviews.Author: rod8137
Reviews.Content: My Wife and arrived via plane which we thought was a great experience and well worth the price. We rented a Jeep at Carlos Jeep Rental which is essential to get around. Make sure to keep your eyes on the road as they are not very well maintained. Hitting one of the potholes could certainly do some damage to your vehicle. We picked up some Breakfast and Lunch items to ensure we didnâ€™t have to leave the premises and therefore giving us more time to enjoy the beach. The Beaches on the island are some of the most Beautiful Iâ€™ve ever seen. Make sure to hike over the hill to Carlos Rosario beach as the Snorkeling there is unbelievable. To get to this trail you need to go to the parking lot at Flamenco Beach and enter through a gate that contains the warning â€œDanger Unauthorized Personnelâ€�. Donâ€™t let that stop you but get ready for a 20-30 minute hike in the jungle. We stayed in unit #7 which had a full kitchen and was clean. The room was ok but the mattress and pillows definitely need replacement. In addition the unit did not have any soap. I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s too much to ask for. I hope that the owners of this Unit make these upgrades as itâ€™s a minor investment that would guarantee return customers. I would recommend staying here as the location is perfect. Just be advised that there will be some inconveniences if you stay in Unit #7 but this may not be the case for the other units as they are all privately owned.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of Culebra Beach Villa Rentals”
Reviews.Author: SG418
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a very good recommendation of our daughter and son in law. We were in Villa 14. We arrived early because we took the 9:00 ferry and rented a jeep from Carlos Jeeps. We were able to get into our villa early which was a pleasant surprise. (I might add that the ferry, jeep rental process can be very stressful. We tried to get ferry tickets in advance but were unable to do so. We arrived at the ferry dock before 6:30 AM to get our tickets. Only one person can go to get the jeep so the others are left baking in the sun with the luggage at the ferry dock). Culebra Beach Villa Rentals look lovely at first glance. Each villa has an abundance of porch furniture and a grill which we were looking forward to using but the mosquitos were so bad you could not be outside for more than a minute without getting eaten alive. There was not a mosquito problem at the beach which was good. After spending some time at the beach the first day we made our way to a little store for groceries. Upon returning to the Villa to cook dinner, we found all of the cookware contained a layer of mouse droppings. It was disgusting and we refused to use the pans. We made our way back to the store and fortunately we were able to return our groceries. That meant eating out every night which was quite expensive. We paid $204 a night and were willing to do so with the assumption we could cook. When we talked to management the next morning about the mouse droppings, the woman came to our villa muttering about the maids not cleaning properly. She proceeded to dump all the mouse droppings onto the kitchen floor. When my husband told her not to do that - she swept them up. She took all of the cookware with her and offered to get us others, but we declined. She did not seem upset about the mouse problem only that we found out about it. On a whim, we placed a few cheerios in the cupboard, and they were gone within an hour. Obviously, the little creatures live there. We asked for a refund more than once and were told she was checking with the owner. Upon checking out, she still said she was checking. We will follow up but are not holding our breaths. Overall, the accomodations are not anything fancy, may or may not be clean, and apparently you never know what you will find. The beach was pretty but honestly, we have seen nicer beaches in Bermuda, Florida and Aruba. Snorkeling is very good right from the beach which is nice. We probably would not stay here again. Finally, be advised if you rent a car to allow plenty of time to fill it up with gas before your return ferry trip. We allowed a couple of hours and barely made it. We had to wait in a line for the only gas station on the island for a very long time. Once again, some were sitting at the ferry with the luggage while my husband took care of the jeep. He only returned just as they were starting to board the ferry. It made for a VERY STRESSFUL situation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, noise and lack of management a problem.”
Reviews.Author: urgelltravellers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in one of the apartment units at Culebra Beach Villas. The location is the best thing going for this place. It is one of the only lodging options located right on Flamenco Beach. The apartment was ok- pretty dark so you didn't want to spend any time indoors (but then again, why would you if you're on Isla Culebra?). The kitchen was equipped with the basics and the place was clean. We had a side porch which had partial views of the beach, though it was very windy so we didn't spend as much time there as we would have liked. We did have several encounters with cockroaches in the apartment, but we honestly didn't feel like that was an issue. The biggest problem for us was the noise. We aren't particularly light sleepers, but Whether it was Spring Break college kids or large groups of main-islanders on the weekend, it seemed that there wasn't a night when we weren't kept up until 1 or 2 a.m. by partying guests staying in the apartments or in the adjacent villas. Since there is no on-sight management to control this, you are really on your own to deal with the problem. We did speak with someone in management after a really unbearable night and were told that the only thing we could do was to call the police. What we found to be particularly annoying about this was that the management's list of rules posted in each apartment states that noise after 10pm is not allowed but then they do nothing to enforce this rule. I don't think we would stay here again mainly because we slept so badly each night. It's a shame because the location really is amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on the most beautiful beach I have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: dleilani
Reviews.Content: I do not care what anyone else says, this was a fantastic place to stay! We had a group of 19 people and we took up 3 different rooms and none of them had bed bugs, everyone had a good nights sleep, and no one had any missing items! All of the rooms were comfortable and had clean linens on all of the beds. We each were given one clean towel, but no hand towels or wash cloths, so if you need these, I suggest bringing your own. All of the kitchens were well stocked with dishes and utensils but there are absolutely no condiments or left overs from former tenants what so ever, so you will need to bring in every thing you need, I mean even salt and pepper. But really it is not that big of a deal, just walk outside and you are on the most beautiful beach in the world! This beach has it all: directly in front of the villas there are great waves to play in, to the left it gets very calm and to the right is a great reef for snorkeling. I have been to many different beaches and I have never seen a better beach in my life!! Why would you want to drive from town, even though it is only 5 minutes away, when you can be right on the beach! The villas are great, really! The hammocks on the lanai, and the tables and chairs outside and all three of the villas we stayed in had nice comfortable furniture in them. Not the Ritz just a nice place to stay. We were very happy to stay here and CAN'T WAIT to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: viajera511
Reviews.Content: I came to Culebra Beach Villas with huge party of about 30 people who were celebrating the honeymoon of a couple who had gotten married a few days before in Old San Juan. The moment that I stepped onto Flamenco Beach I couldn't believe that such a beautiful corner of the world existed. White sand, clear beautiful water. It was indeed paradise. It was worth the ordeal to make the reservations at Culebra Beach Villas, which involved me calling at the moment their office opened and speaking Spanish to the front desk. They didn't answer emails and rarely picked up the phone during the day. The rooms were expensive, but the location was amazing! No frills rooms, but with TV and fully equipped kitchen. There was a cockroach in my room one night, but that's to be expected in tropical locations. No restaurant on site, so you must rent a golf cart/car to go into town for food. BBQ pits available. Don't expect staff to be around to wait on you. Fully self-sufficient vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, need a car, avoid weekends...”
Reviews.Author: mimoosa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at supposedly the best beach of the island (Flamingo), place of a unique beauty that gets little washed out by the crowds on the weekends. Apart of it, it remains a quiet paradise spot, with turquoise sea and beautiful landscape on the horizon. I booked in the CULEBRA BEACH VILLAS (it was fully booked on the day of our arrival): a facility has itâ€™s own kitchen, nice terrace with hammocks and barbecue. The place is in a bit isolated, only the loyal mosquitoes will keep you company in the night. The way to spice up our stay (as we didnâ€™t rent a car) was to call a taxi. Calling a taxi was a stressful experience, as most of the drivers donâ€™t take the call, if they do they do not speak English, if they do speak English, they may not be willing to come and if they do, they will definitely not come on time. I fact, they donâ€™t. Come at all until you call them again and again. Anyway, the property is charming, the girl on reception desk kind and helpful. The rooms and facilities are clean and well kept. They sell only water and ice here, but you can walk to the other end of the beach, where you can find kiosk with fast food, drinks, cigarettes and cheep public busses/taxis. I would come here again only with a car. There are only two companies on the island providing car hire, one of them has its desk at the airport ADDITIONAL INFORMATION : I spent a week (18-25.5) in Puerto Rico. The trip was divided into 3 nights stay at Vieques, 2 nights at Culebra and last 2 nights I spend in Old San Juan. Talking for myself one night would have been enough to explore the town (in case, that you are not into analytical sightseeing or gold shopping). Donâ€™t take me wrong, the place is beautiful and incredibly atmospheric, but I prefer to spend my vacation outdoor, therefore I would exchange one night at SJ for an extra night on Vieques, still I wouldnâ€™t go to Puerto Rico without paying visit to San Juan! WEATHER Weather was good, on the island only rained couple of times in the night, and lightly for short period of a day. In SJ rained quite often, but it made the walking easier. Generally I found this time of year good: not only for the weather, but also because the beaches were quite empty (except weekend on Flamingo Beach, Culebra, avoid if you can!) VIEQUES or CULEBRA? I preferred Vieques, but I wouldnâ€™t be surprised if anyone would disagree. There is fine difference between the two places and picking one of them as the â€œbetter oneâ€� says more about the picker than about the islandâ€¦ Basically Vieques is WILDER, have more beaches (located in houseless Wildlife Refuge). It is unique for its Bioluminescent Bay (patently the best one in the world) as well as for the semi-wild horses running around. On the other hand Culebra is a tropical paradise in a more obvious way with eye-taking curves etc. It is CUTE. Basically the choice is yours: pick between the cute and the wild beauty. If you wish to visit both, the only direct transport between them is by air. Air Flamingo has number flies a day for 25$/oneway. One more unpleasant thing to mention is the constant presence of MOSQUITOS. I used Off (15% deet) during my stay and it didn't seem to help. I got bitten badly on everyday basis. However the Bio Bay (Mosquito Bay) guide recommended to make a lotion consisting baby oil and eucalyptus

Reviews.Title: “Must go back soon! <3”
Reviews.Author: Pakita72
Reviews.Content: Needed to get away ASAP, but had not to much time, so couldn't go too far from home (SJ, PR). Booked the villas for weekend stay, and I loved it. Arrived around noon on Friday and our villa was not yet ready, so we left our bags at the office and walked some 25 steps to the beach. The most beautiful beach I have been. In less than an hour, our room was ready, even though they say check in was at 4pm. If your villa is ready, they won't make you wait. We settled in (Villa #7, for two), it was very clean, kitchen fully equipped and everything working properly. We had no problem sleeping at night, even though all villas seemed to be occupied. We really got to rest. Beach is a few feet away. You might find some kitties or chicken in your porch, we didn't mind :) Note: there is no food nearby, since we knew, we took our groceries with us. They do sell water and ice. Also, not too many bus drivers are eager of going there, but find a nice one that will, and stay with his number for your trip. If he took you once, he'll take you again. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “decent accomodation on beautiful beach, ruined by THEFT of 2 I-touches”
Reviews.Author: namrikyi
Reviews.Content: Lovely beach. Rooms are decent, but nothing great, and need better maintenance. What you're really paying for is the location on the beach. Our AC did not work in the living room, and DVD/TV player did not work either (a disappointment for our children who we hoped would tune out to a movie at night). Staff could not fix either. Avoid staying during busy weeks -- like Easter or spring break for Puerto Rican schools. The otherwise tranquil place becomes overrun with young revellers. We had a good stay, and would have returned again, but for the bad taste left by the disappearances of our I touches (2 of them!) as we were packign up and clearing out of the room as a team of house cleaners descended on us. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in Culebra - must stay”
Reviews.Author: davetron5000
Reviews.Content: While it's no-frills, you really can't beat staying RIGHT on Flamenco Beach. It is one of the most beautiful beaches in the WORLD, rarely is crowded, and staying here puts you seconds from this beach. The villas are clean, though low-frills. If you stay here, you should rent a jeep, since it's outside of the Dewey and not exactly walking distance. You can certainly take the Publicos (they are cheap and plentiful), but you have less control over coming and going (as well as destinations on the island). For lunches, the "tent city" by the nearby campground can suffice, but you may need to cook for breakfast and dinner. There are grills available, and a few grocery stores in town. The upshot is that this is sleep, relaxing and an awesome place to stay if you aren't looking for some 5-star pampered experience. Of course, if you were, why go to Culebra at all?!?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: nabreu85
Reviews.Content: I stay in the number 5 Villa, everything was very clean, all the appliances work fine. It was very cozy, with the hamacas "slings" and a wooden swing. Our villa has a private barbecue, and also they had hamacas in front of the beach. The staff was very helpful and nice. Even though the cell phones did not work there they have a free phone for the guests so you can call to PR and the US. If you walk to the beach then you got reception. You should rent a car or bring one from the Island. If you want to bring a car to the Island you should plan at least one month ahead, better two. I will come again to stay there we have a great time. I went there with my two year old and my 19 years all son and both of them have a great time. BRing bugs spray because in the afternoon the mosquitoes bites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but filled with bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jquent
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a terribly overpriced, bed bug infested hotel with the most amazing location in Culebra, this hotel is for you! I know that each room and villa is privately owned, so the conditions are different for each room. However, my family rented Apt. 1B, which consists of two bedrooms. The first night we woke up with bites all over our bodies. We thought they were mosquito bites at first, but after the second night and wearing long sleeves, only to still wake up in the morning with many new bites, we decided to move into the adjoining room to sleep. The staff was incredibly helpful and tried their best to clean for us, but even in the new room we all received bites. We were so incredibly itchy and it really put a damper on our otherwise incredibly beautiful vacation. We complained to the management and they moved us to Apt 4B on the top floor. But guess what.......more bed bug bites!!!!!! My entire family looked like we had chicken pox. My poor son kept saying, this is not the best vacation ever. I want to go home! Take your chances if you stay here. I think it's terribly overpriced for what you actually get. I love the island of Culebra and definitely plan to visit again next year. But take my advice: do not stay here on Flamenco beach. There are plenty of MUCH better accomodations in town. Just rent a car and you'll be fine....and hopefully bed bug free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: lotusdm
Reviews.Content: After our initial stay I have decided to make it a tradition to visit the villas. The place is amazing. I loved waking up in this small and cozy villa and walking to the beach with my coffee and watch the sun rise. It was our first time traveling to Culebra, even though I am puertorrican, I am so proud to say that this is by far the most beautful beach that I've ever seen. Make sure to bring "Off" (mosquito repelant) and bring groceries cause it's a challenge and an expense to go buy things in the island. get to the ferry early, if your plans are to board the 9am ferry, get there by 6am or buy the tickets the day before, by 1pm. We had the best time of our lives, but the next time we are bringing everything we need from main land, specially some really good meat to bbq. Be aware that the villas are eco friendly, so the entrance is rocky on purpose, not because they're lacking attention. Do not count on taxis being too eager to go there as for they consider it a hassle, but they will get there if you call them with plenty of time in advance. Make sure to go have dinner at Mamacitas! the shrimp satay IS AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Rent an apartment to Myrta Ramos. Real bad conditions.”
Reviews.Author: Queta1
Reviews.Content: These are apartments rent by owners. If the owner don't provide the appropriate maintenance the experience can be terrible. Avoid to rent Myrta Ramos apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Location ! Location ! not worth it”
Reviews.Author: dreamteampr
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAT at the Flamenco Apartments, the place stinks, moldy, the shower had little is any water, the kitchen well ! not good. Other than walking distance to the beach, just stay somewhere else and rent a CAR ! ! ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “An OK place on a world class beach”
Reviews.Author: Egghead2004
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I start? The beach! World Class! nice horseshoe shape, secluded, and nice sand. There is coral reefe protects one side of beach for kids, then near the villas, the waves come in pretty high sometimes. I have pics of some 6-8 foot waves. To the left side there are tents behind the beach where some locals set up tents for cooking local food and making some great fresh tropical fruit frappes. The only beach I want to go back to more than Flamenco is at the Divi in Aruba, that beach sand was like powdered sugar, Flamenco is close, but not quite like that. We stayed at the villas on our second visit to Culebra. It is worth stopping at Carlos Jeep rental in town for transportation. During the day there are taxi vans that trek back and forth from the public area back into town, but in the evening forget it, you are stuck unless you have a telephone of a taxi cab who will come out to get you...$$$. The villas, well there is OK and just plain bad. We stayed with 2 other couples and my 3 year old. One couple had a cabin further behind the beach, my wife and I along with her brother and sister n law had a low level room in the main building next to each other. Our room was so MOLDY we could not breath or sleep the first night. terrible. The service desk (itself in its own villa) gave us some perfumed spray to help, but this was just bad. My brother n law's room, right next to us was fine, so I guess it's the luck of the draw. Too bad, because it was a nice short barefoot walk to the beach and there was a nice little porch. We were able to move into the room in the same Villa as the other couple we travelled with. Much better, but still just average accomodations. We had fun feeding all the chickens and cats and cooking on the outdoor grills. The villas also had a nice hammock on the porch. If you want to stay on a truely spectacular beach that is not overpopulated, you need to stay here. Don't fall for the beach bar and food advertisements, there is no liquor and it was only chips/candy/soda. Oh, and it was closed for our entire stay anyway. There are better place to stay on the island, but why I would stay here again...even though it isn't that great, it's all about the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vianni911
Reviews.Content: Honestly, don't expect high luxury, but expect the most AMAZING beach and an absolutely acceptable villa !! Some villas are decorated differently, since each villa is owned by different owners so some can be better than others, but you basically get a fully stocked villa with dishes, cups, pots and pans (which you can go grocery shopping in a local shop and get all the ingredients you need to cook or grill out!), towels, all airconditioned, and an outdoor grill and hammock! You cannot ask for anything more... you are literally SECONDS from the most gorgeous beach in the entire island, let alone one of the best in the world and it's truly paradise. Get up early and walk to Flamenco, for it is completely desserted and it is just bliss. Otherwise, this place is perfect, we stayed from Friday through Monday and didn't have a single complaint. Well worth the money and you will have a fabulous time! Flamenco beach is truly paradise...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach; basic but acceptable villa with mini-kitchens (plus)”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, after reading the hot and cold reviews about this property you are probably pretty confused. I think the problem why the reviews are so different is that some people stay at this property with the wrong understanding of exactly what it is ... and what it is not. I was very apprehensive about this property given the poor reviews. After staying there myself I can report that I am pleasantly surprised. I would absolutely recommend this property. Specifically, I would recommend villa #7 (which is one of the concrete villas behind the tall main building). We stayed three nights in villa #7. I had the manager show me some of the other units in the â€œhotelâ€� portion (the larger building, and they were not as nice. Some of them have ocean views, but I thought the villa we stayed at was much better. However, you do have to go in with the right frame of mind. This is not a hotel. Don't expect any service. Keep in mind that this is an acceptable place to stay on one of the worldâ€™s best beaches. The frame of mind you have to take into this property is that you are here to enjoy the world-class beach, and the villa is just an acceptable place to stay. It is right on the beach, and the easiest way to enjoy an amazing location! In short ... you stay at this property for the beach. Period. The owners know that. That's why it is not an amazing property. However, it's not a dump either (as some report). It is nice, with a certain charm. We loved the beach and found the accommodations acceptable. The bed is small and austere. The shower is a little run down, but acceptable. The villa has a mini-kitchen with fridge, microwave and stovetop (which was a BIG bonus for us, because we cooked our own food - saving $ on eating out and taxis). If you go to this property with the understanding that you are going for the beach and not the resort experience, you will have an amazing time. Why? Because the beach is that damn good. Flamenco Beach is such an amazing crescent of beach-heaven that you won't matter that the villa is a little run down in places. Everything about the beach is amazing. Don't expect much in the way of facilities. This is a hidden treasure of a beach. I have been to the best beaches in Hawaii, Florida, Caribbean, etc., and this is one of the best I have found. Stay at this place, and as long as you have the right understanding, you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: cbsworth
Reviews.Content: We only discovered the culebra beach villas on the second to last night of our 10 days in PR after arriving in culebra without a reservation. We stayed in the building with our apt./room facing the beach. It was stunning and we were so sad to leave. TBoth my boyfriend and I have traveled extensively and this is one of the neatest places we have ever been.

Reviews.Title: “friendly people, clean, quiet, AMAZING beach”
Reviews.Author: damaryz76
Reviews.Content: This villa at this price on THIS beach is a steal. It's a quiet secluded beautiful little piece of heaven... You have to go in knowing it's not the Ritz, it's a villa so you have to be self sufficient and not need a lobby with a concierge in it. The rooms are clean, they provide what you need (coffee maker,pots/pans, cups), but its more about LOCATION here, you can't ask for a better spot. Ok, bring your own sheets and towels if you're picky but they'll give you clean ones, they're just not brandy new. No one mentioned this but I should because this was the ONLY problem I ran into. I couldn't get a phone signal (multiple carriers, AT&T, TMobile) so calling a taxi became a fiasco... so now I know next time I will rent a car. But my problem had nothing to do with the villa. I am going back next month, staying at the same place because it really is a great escape... The owner was a friendly helpful local who welcomes you with a friendly smile and warm handshake. Go, you will enjoy. Tip - Rent a car, yes the taxis are cheap but they don't come right away, they keep odd hours, they are over crowded, they drink while driving, they're like party locals driving you around. It wasn't dangerous but it was a little crazy for my taste.... Especially if you have children or a large group, rent the car.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: lilsmi
Reviews.Content: Simple and unpretentious Culebra Beach Villas was absolutely a great beach cottage rental. It is on the most perfect beach, and each studio comes with a large verandah, hammock and grill. They also provide with you with all the kitchen utensils. Our studio room was pretty basic with a view of a gorgeous green hill. Most cottages do not have a beach view, unless you are in the wooden beach front building. However these rooms are really packed together and not as private. The people in the office were very nice and allowed us to check in a little early. On the 2nd day our home rigged shower broke, but they came by right away and fixed it. It is definitely not a boutique hotel or resort. But super charming. Btw the residents of the place include a dozen cats and roosters.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to vacation”
Reviews.Author: gissele303
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to Culebra Beach Villas for a week during the month of October. We flew from San Juan Puerto Rico to Isla Culebra and minutes after arriving we fell in love with the people and the Island. We met some of the most friendliest people as soon as we arrived to the small airport. It turns out we happened to be on the same flight with someone from management who then proceeded to offer us a ride to the villas saving us time and confusion. When we arrived to the villas we were quickly checked in and invited to a bbq with management and other locals from the island. Soon after that, they made every attempt to make us feel comfortable and have a wonderful experience during our stay. They gave us tips on what to do and see, and even invited us to their houses for drinks. The villa we stayed in had everything we needed to make ourselves at home and was clean. We found utensils, pots, microwave, refrigerator, etc, etc. We were able to cook our own romantic dinners in one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. We have traveled to many places but we have never before had the service, friendliness, and detail we had during our stay in Culebra Beach Villas. Also since we arrived during slow season we practically had Flaminco Beach to ourselves! The only thing this place lacks is a closer grocery store since it takes about 10-15 minutes to the closest one. I would recommend taking energy bars or some sort of snack to have around until you can make it to the store especially if you have children. And believe me, if you have children this is the place to stay! I cannot wait to go back and maybe take my niece since the beach is perfect for children as well. If you are looking to relax in a down to earth place with wonderful people this is the place. I would not recommend this place for anyone expecting to stay in expensive resorts with room service. Gissele

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: rubencotto
Reviews.Content: I was in the villa with my wife and my experience was realy goog ,the room clean, the outdoor clean, the place is realy close of the beach nobody doing noise in the villas, the manager margarita is realy friendly with the guest, we stay by 3 night and 4 days, everything POSITIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but isolated”
Reviews.Author: Gretchenls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Culebra Beach Villas because I had wanted to stay right on Flamenco Beach. We actually loved the property- the cabins and landscaping were beautiful and Flamenco Beach is absolutely stunning. Our unit was basic but very clean and nicely decorated and it had a spacious deck where we spent our evenings. As other visitors have stated, the hotel is very isolated and guests should plan to stock up on provisions in town if you have not rented a car or scooter- there are a couple of well stocked grocery stores. There is no restaurant on site, but a beach bar was supposed to be opening in December. We were in Culebra during the rainy season, so the mosquitos/bugs were pretty bad and we definitely needed bug spray. My husband and I were saddened by the amount of stray/feral cats on the property. Some were socialized and in relatively good shape, but others seemed to be feral. They were fearful of us, hungry, skinny and had various wounds, i.e. deep neck wound, eye infection and tail sores. We are unsure if management provides any care for the animals. We heard after the fact from another party that Culebra Beach Villas refuses offers of assistance in order to improve the lives of these animals. We would love to return, but we have serious reservations about the potential neglect of animals on their property.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to enjoy the beautiful beach- Flamenco”
Reviews.Author: ido4u
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about Culebra beach villas rental. The villas had all I needed- from comfortable bed to great equipment kitchen and above all the location which was perfect as I really wanted to wake up everyday in one of the most amazing and famous beaches- Flamenco. I also loved the hammock/sling which was quite good when I wanted to rest outside. There's also barbeque place in each villa. On the other hand, you must take in mind that flamenco beach is little bit isolated in Culebra. I came in Culebra in off season so I didn't expect to see much of tourists, but to be honest I was little bit shock to find out that I was the only one there on my first day of arrival. Moreover, when I got to the beach rental the office was empty and no one actually checked in me. The owner left me a note with the room number also saying the key was inside the room (villa 15). After settling, I realized that I need to go back to the main area of the island for some groceries but unfortunately my cellular didn't have sign so when I tried to call from the public phone near the office I found out that there was no line there too. After few days one of the locals explained me that during construction in the island they hit the public phone lines so they no longer work in all island (September â€“October 2007). So I had to walk all the way back to the city for water and food I needed. I believe that if someone was there at the office to check me in, he would have called taxi for me. My tip for you is after you drop off the ferry, make a stop in grocery store which is very close to the ferry place and make sure you get all you need. Another thing you should take in mind that taxi ends their service around 05:30 pm. As for the season - the end of September and beginning of October- I guess I was lucky because rain caught me only one day and it was mostly raining at night, so I had the whole day for "beaching". Even though it wasn't the perfect place I would dream of for my vacation, you have to face the true- the location of it RULEZ. And If you're on beach vacation, I don't believe you'll enjoy the same if you weren't staying at Flamenco (which is, as I see it, the biggest and only attraction in the island). Ps try not to feed the chicken or the cats otherwise you'll get a wake up call every morning asking for more food. I also uploaded video so enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive with Problems”
Reviews.Author: SanJuanBoricua
Reviews.Content: The Culebra Beach Villas Hotel is very expensive for what they offered. Itâ€™s really a camping ground with beds and a/c to sleep. The beds are as hard as a rock and the bedding used is probably 10 years old. Appliances are in good working condition but dirty. Be aware of the monster size flying â€œcucarachasâ€� while you sleep. We experience a REALLY bad odor from cats and chickens/roosters feces everywhere. We had to clean the porch with lavender cleaner in order to be outside. The unfreindly Management could only offer running water from 8am to 8pm. So, if you have to use the bathroom in the middle of the nightâ€¦.too bad. In addition, they do not provide any towels, soap, toilette paper or dish soap for your stay. They DO NOT clean very well, because we found inside the bedroom closet and â€œoldâ€� female underwear and several kids bathing suits under the beds. The Management is only available a few hours during the day, even though they live in one of the villas in the premises. The website clearly noted that in each villa an X number of guests are allowed. But several of the villas around us that only had beds for 2-4, but they had 8 to 9 guestsâ€¦.making the noise and trash more noticeable. We reported certain issues to the Manager, his response â€“ he is only there to hand out and pick up the villas keys. What it is inside each the villa â€œgoodâ€� or â€œbadâ€� or â€œinsufficientâ€� is what the owner supplies and nothing else is provided. We do noticed that behind the Managers Office a storage room, with bath soap, rolls of paper towels, toilet paper, dish soapâ€¦.etc. we visited this room thinking it was the office and were surprise when Management told us that they DO NOT provide any of these items. Management was very upset that we visited the storage room....humm! Good Luck if you are thinking on renting at the Culebra Beach Villas. My advice --- please stay in the downtown â€œferryâ€� area hotels and take the $2.00 taxi to the free Public Flamenco Beach.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views”
Reviews.Author: mndy77
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 other adults for 4 nights and we had a great time. The 2 bedroom apartment was clean and spacious. A little rundown but better to track in sand that way. The kitchen was fully equiped and the shower was super hot. Some resident cats kept us company and the roosters were a wonderful alarm clock! Flamenco beach is amazing. Very empty and quiet. Local culebra residents are womderfully helpful, most speaking good english. The hammocks are great and the bbq area is spacious for a dinner party with new friends. We never wanted to leave. Love culebra!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate relaxation on the most beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: crunnermom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four nights at Culebra Beach Villas. We arrived with some reservations having read a few very negative reviews of these villas on this website. Our experience there was very POSITIVE. Our studio unit was number three behind the main building. The room was clean, comfortable and cool. The frig kept our beer cold and the freezer provided ice. The hammock on the porch was a comfy place to nap. It was a two minute walk to the soft silky sand of Flamenco Beach. There you could just hang out soaking up the sunshine. If you wanted you could jump in the turquoise blue water to boogie board or take a short walk down the beach to snorkel. Most days we hiked a mile or so to go snorkeling along a coral reef that had the most incredible sea life. We got there by 9 or 9:30 and had the beach to ourselves for quite sometime. I love to travel and explore whenever I can. I've been so very lucky to have visited incredibly beautiful beaches on the Outer Banks of North Carolina, the panhandle of Florida, Harbour Island in the Bahamas, Essaouira in Morocco and Zanibar off the coast of Tanzania. Flamenco Beach in Culebra is one of the most spectacular. We loved the relaxing atmosphere of the villas. We didn't mind the roosters roaming around and cockledoodledooing 24/7. We enjoyed the party life of some of our neighbors in villas closeby. We liked vacationing with the locals. I wish I could return tomorrow. Ahhh....it was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “The Beach was A+ but room was B-”
Reviews.Author: lvn2travl
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 4 year old daughter stayed in Unit 3A at CBV from 2/20-2/22. The location is fabulous! It was so nice hearing the ocean from your bedroom, that was def worth the price! But the villa itself, for the price, should of been better. Half of our shutters did not open, therefore, we could not get any type of breeze through them. Some of the windows were missing screens so we could not open them at all. I went to open a cabinet in the kitchen and the handle fell off. The villa def needed some improvements but it did not ruin our vacation. We rented a jeep thru carlos jeep for the two days. toured the island. very nice. flamenco beach is out of this world and the location was awesome but i dont know if the actual villa was worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Living in a cave.”
Reviews.Author: LittleRaven
Reviews.Content: In 22 years of visiting 24 islands in the Caribbean I have experienced only two beaches that I like better than Flamenco. Classic, beautiful, long, wide, soft white sand. My room, however, was dreadful. No window in the bedroom. It was like going into a cave. When I asked the next morning to be moved, I was told that all the rooms were taken. That was not true. There were very few people on the property. Even on the weekend, it didn't look like even half the units were being used. I walked around at night and counted those with lights. I was in 1-C. The couple next to me was in 1-E. (I don't know what happened to 1-D. Maybe that's where Harry Potter and his friends stay!) 1-E was even worse than mine, narrower, and only one window in the kitchen and none in the bedroom. They had made their reservation in November. I had made mine October 8. Why the resort assigned such horrible rooms to early renters and why they refused to move us to something better is a mystery. I talked to three young people who had a better unit on the second floor, and they had just made their reservation the weekend before. I met another couple who invited me to see their room. It was on the second floor front and was very nice, French doors opening onto the porch with a great view. Lots of windows. They had made their reservation only three weeks earlier, at the end of December! Maybe many of the other upper rooms are as nice as theirs and that's why we are reading such drastically different reviews about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, Romantic and Right on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: ladyesq
Reviews.Content: Just to set the context, I'm a woman in my mid-30s who travels for pleasure frequently and lives in NYC. Just got back from a stay here over xmas 2007. Culebra Beach Villas I have to agree with the other reviewers, that when you go to Culebra Beach Villas, you should go into it knowing what to expect - and you will not be disappointed. These are clean places to sleep, somewhere to keep your beer or beach drinks cold and to hang your snorkeling gear or bathing suits to dry - but not much else. You don't need anymore as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world sits feet away. You definitely stay here for the location. The villas are very basic. We stayed in #10, which was a 1-bdroom. Paid US$175 per night. The outer room had 2 twin beds and since there was only 2 of us traveling, we were able to spread out our stuff. Our villa was complete with microwave, fridge, stove, sink, etc. -- what you need to put together a snack or lunch. The bedroom was fine, the sheets and pillowcases appeared to be clean - athough if you have dust mite allergies as I do, best to bring your own pillow/sheet dust mite covers - I could tell there were a lot of dust mites in the bedroom. Our villa didn't have a hammock but there were several nearby and they are big enough for two. Although we would've loved a little more water pressure in the shower, we had plenty of room, hot water, in the bathroom etc. If you desire large bath towels, bring your own. The ones they give you do the trick, but they are small and they are not changed during your stay (the sheets/pillowcases are not changed either unless you are there longer than 4 days). Ditto on beach towels as they are not provided. All other places to stay are in town or by the harbor - this is the only place steps from the beach. Our front door lock was squeaky and the AC in the bedroom wasn't as strong as we'd like, but hey, you're in Culebra! Beach I've been to a lot of beaches around the world - this one is truly breathtaking. Pristine white sand. Gorgeous blue water with mild surf and no condos or other buildings anywhere in sight. Very few people as well. . Definitely walk the beach at night - the stars are amazing. Other stuff Tony, who runs the front desk, is helpful and responsive. He set us up with kayaks and made some local calls for us (our cells didn't get any reception at the Villas, only in town). We rented beach chairs for $5 each per day (though they take them back at 4pm). We saw some people bbq-ing, but we thought the grills were a bit spartan and dirty and ours was missing the grill part. Lots of beach cats, hens and roosters and a friendly but nosy beach dog at the Villas - we had fun with them as they are relatively clean and tame and we even bought some cheap chicken feed in town. While the road to the villas is bumpy as it is unpaved, we preferred being able to "get away" even from the small town in Culebra so we were really alone. The Villas runs on cisterrn water - better to be safe than sorry - drink only bottled water, you can buy it by the gallon relatively cheaply in the supermercado in town. Snorkeling by the hotel is not great, the reefs are pretty dead. If you check the threads for Culebra, you'll learn there are closeby snorkling sites that are excellent. Make sure you buy what you need in town - sun screen, snacks, mosquito/bug spray (a MUST) etc as there are no amenities like this at the villas. Strongly recommend you rent a car if you are staying more than a day or two. I recommend eating at Barbara Rosas - great home cooking, right on her porch. Mamacitas was good for breakfast and dinner as well, and had a live drum band playing at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Culebra!!”
Reviews.Author: AnaliaMiami
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at Culebra Beach Villas last summer, and was amazing, the place is so fresh, the room was very clean and the peole are very friendly. We waked up and went directly to Flamenco Beach, that was awesome. That does not have comparisson, you "are" in the best beach. And during the night, you can see the most wonderfull sky with a million of star, because there is no light contamination. I want to return the next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, locagion”
Reviews.Author: FancyDay
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in 3-bdrm unit #4-A for 4 nights in March. My expectations were low after reading the reviews. But we had a fantastic stay and would probably return. The location right on Playa Flamenca is unsurpassed - pristine and private. Even on the weekends, it wasn't that crowded (I know that may be different in summer when Puerto Ricans vacation there). Our unit was on the 3rd floor - lots of stairs, but that wasn't a problem for us. The balcony overlooked the beach - the views were fantastic. The unit was spartan, but extremely clean. The beds were OK, linens were basic. The kitchen was stocked with all the basic essentials for cooking, but nothing else was supplied except sponge and soap (e.g., no paper towels). We used the BBQs downstairs. Tony, the property manager, was friendly and helpful. He gave us his restaurant recommendations and happily fixed a A/C unit in one of our bedrooms. Ice and water are available for sale from the office. A car is a necessity here, in my opinion, for grocery shopping and restaurant meals in town. If you want to be on one of the most spectacular beaches in the Caribbean, you like privacy and peace and you don't mind self-catering, Culebra Beach Villas is for you. If you expect ANY amenities, don't consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with bedbugs..”
Reviews.Author: IBX
Reviews.Content: Great location but were eaten alive by the bedbugs in shack number 11. Also, the chickens will wake you up in the middle of the night and you won't get much sleep. They charge you for ice, the building 'manager' is not very friendly, never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay!”
Reviews.Author: fruitflyboy
Reviews.Content: This place has gotten a lot of bad reviews in the past, so we were prepared for a not-so-great experience. But everything was great. The woman who greeted us was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We rented studio villa #7. There are nice hammocks and swings outside each villa. The beach, as everybody notes, is gorgeous. Staying in these villas means that you can sit on the pure white sand at night and watch the moonlight AND take an early morning stroll right up to where there are colorfully painted former US tanks. There is supposedly good snorkeling on the right side of the beach, but be careful, the water can get rough sometimes. There is some nice snorkeling at Carlos Rosario and Tamarindo, a short walk from here. Overall, we highly recommend this experience. It's obviously not a luxury vacation, but if you want to experience the ocean in a relaxed setting, Culebra is great! Oh, remember to take mosquito repellent and use it generously (when you're outside the room. Inside is fine and has A/C).

Reviews.Title: “Memorable !!”
Reviews.Author: godessathena
Reviews.Content: August 14-16, 2006 My husband and I spent 2 days and 2 nights at Culebra Beach Villa, studio #16. Since each villa is individually owned I can only rate the room that we were in but it was perfect !!! I would only stay at CBV again! The entire place was very nice and clean. Being on the beach is incredible! What no one has posted before is that the public beaches close at dark. I don't know how well they enforce it, but technically they are closed. The sun sets around 5:30 and by 6:30 it is dark! When staying at CBV you have your own private end of the beach and Flamenco beach is prettier than the photos on the websites! I promise!! Our first night there we went walking on the beach under a blanket of stars and danced on the beach. We were up early the next morning playing in the water. We hiked over to Carlos Rosario and snorkled. The path was much harder to locate than we'd planned but we found it. The air conditioner in the room worked almost too well! The best way to plan your visit is to bring your own food if come over on the ferry ;otherwise, go to the store after you arrive, buy what you need and don't leave CBV until it is time to leave the island. The rest of the island left us a bit cold, but the beach was awesome. We would go back and take friends in a heatbeat! They have an outdoor grill on the patio of every villa and an outdoor table and chairs. There is no reason to leave. Just hang out and relax. I highly recommend CBV. Word of warning...take antibiotics with you. The pharmacist is only on the island on Tuesdays and doesn't arrive until 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Not everything it's cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: girllaw
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Pr and have stayed in Vieques and Culebras in private residences, hotels, B & BÂ´s as well as in boats stationed in one of the spectacular bays. They are both increcdible, pristine and unique! But Culebra Beach Villas was definitely not what was advertised. Too bad I didnÂ´t listen to friends and reviews! My birthday was not so much fun due to my decision to stay in this place...I will try to explain so future visitors can make an informed decision according to their interests. First, the posivie reviews I have read refer mainly to the shacks that are located behind the main building (individual apartments). THOSE are rather nice and clean but they donÂ´t have a view since the main building blocks it. Neverthless, the main building is, simply, falling apart and the owners donÂ´t want to invest money in it since the government is apparently trying to eliminate the oceanfront structure because it is damaging the beach (it is literally in the sand). I managed to get in touch with the owner because the nice people form JM Rentals, seeing as we were going to leave early from Culebra, got us in touch with him. To no use, since the second room they gave us was still in the same main building and again had no electricity in part of the room (the bathroom, so no hot water) and the alarm went off at 7am!!!! there were no employees around so nothing was done about it... Although the beach is RIGHT in front and it is amazing!!!! there is no restaurant except for a place they want to call a bar or something, but just looking at it with its flies and the stench made you want to go elsewhere. So, you are at the beach but have to move around to eat if you donÂ´t have a kitchen or just donÂ´t want to cook. Taxis donÂ´t like to drive there since the small road into the hotel is full of potholes... If you want beachfront and some place to eat, go with Tamarindo Estates. Although the beach is not directly in front of the hotel and Flamenco is way better, it is still really close by and the hotel is wonderful for around the same price. Culebra Beach Villas, for the price, is not comparable to other hotels. I would never expect luxury in Culebra since its charm is kinda roughing it, but I do expect clean rooms, electricity, and at least cordial staff when things get tough. Especially for the price (I payed 135 plus 9% tax for a full bed)! So if you idea is to honeymoon, to have nice places to eat around and you donÂ´t have a car, beware of Culebra Beach Villas! If you want to have a nice beach walking distance and have a car to drive to restaurants, ask specifically for a shack in the back and hope the staff is in a good mood that day!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and relatives stayed here last year and told me what a great beach Flamenco Beach was, to the point that we all decided to visit again this year. They warned me that the hotel was pretty basic and it is, but is undergoing some renovations and it was a lot better than I was expecting considering some reviews. You will get what you pay for, and I got my $'s worth. The hotel is not filthy as some poeple would claim but is not a 3 star hotel either. If you want a 5 star hotel,this will not work for you. But this is not the hotel's fault it is the "unrealistic expectation" sindrome that some poeple suffer from. if you want basic accomadations in the middle of the most beautiful beach in the tropics, without breaking the bank, this is it. We already are booking our next trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “BEST TIME OF MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent a week at the Villas and it was beautiful. We stayed at apt 2A and I could not belive how all I had to do to beat to the beach was walk down a flight of steps. I recomend these villas to anyone who is planning on going to Culebra. Air Comditioned rooms right on the beach... what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach is one of the world's best. Stayed in Villa 18 and it just got an overhaul. Very nice. Will be back in April. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “What a spot”
Reviews.Author: valeriol
Reviews.Content: Anyone going to this location expecting a resort is a spoiled idiot and should stick to ugly Howard Johnsons in Miami Beach. The Villas are located on possibly the most amazing beach you'll ever see. The rooms are simple and provide the basics, including satellite TV (must be a recent addition, since their own brochure claims no TV). You have available kitchen and an outdoor barbecue. Better rent a car because you need to bring everything and 's quite a hike. We were hoping to rent bikes, but the road is too beat up to allow you to bring groceries on a bike.

Reviews.Title: “More like a shack - Buttttt”
Reviews.Author: absherkathy
Reviews.Content: Went 2004. If you are looking for a nice resort. Then dont look here. The rooms are nasty dirty. But I hate to say I will go again. The location is incredible. I never rode the Taxi I just rented a bike. Went lobster hunting had paella with some locals. I work for an airline and have to say this is one nasty dirty hotel. But looking for a beautiful beach here it is. I guess it is not crowded because nobody wants to stay there.

HotelInfo.Name: Culebra Beach Villas
HotelInfo.Address: Flamenco Beach, Puerto Rico
